author: terencechain
content:
Is there a corresponding engine api update PR with respect to https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4023

I'm slightly confused to alightment as reading the consensus spec isn't completely clear

For `NewPayload` , do we still pass in `target_blobs_per_block`?  It does it in the consensus spec `verify_and_notify_new_payload`
For `Fcu+attribute`, we have a new attribute for passing in target and max blobs, do we have a new `Fcu` end point here? V5?

cc <@539495253418180618>

author: terencechain
content:
Nvm, it's removed in https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4046
Sorry for the confusion, I understand it better now

author: parithosh
content:
I've updated the pinned message with geth, prysm as well as lodestar images. 

Bugs still present:
- Prysm is sending max blob count in engineAPI newPayload message (probably remnant of 7742). 
- Seemingly at random, teku fails to release blobs on time and Prysm/Lodestar complain with `"Failed to reconstruct blob sidecars" error="could not get blobs: got an unexpected error in JSON-RPC response: context canceled"`. I'm not able to isolate a reason yet, things look fine from the teku perspective. 
- I see some random missed slots from besu-teku, unsure why this is still happening.

author: parithosh
content:
I definitely still see some of these messages from slots proposed by teku: 
```
[cl-6-prysm-geth] time="2024-12-27 20:48:55" level=error msg="Failed to reconstruct blob sidecars" error="could not get blobs: got an unexpected error in JSON-RPC response: context canceled" prefix=sync
```
So something about blob sidecars seems off in teku.
